Low: [Mind Over Mood](https://www.mindovermood.com/) – Practical CBT exercises you can do on your own.
[Verywell Mind](https://www.verywellmind.com/) – Daily articles and tips on mental wellness.
[Insight Timer](https://insighttimer.com/) – Thousands of free guided meditations.
[7 Cups](https://www.7cups.com/) – Free, anonymous chat with trained volunteer listeners.
Keep a gratitude journal: write 3 things you’re grateful for each night.
Digital detox: avoid screens for one evening per week to reset your mind.
Moderate: [Sleepio](https://www.sleepio.com/) – Digital CBT for insomnia to improve sleep quality.
Check your Employee Assistance Program (EAP) for free counseling benefits.
[Crisis Text Line](https://www.crisistextline.org/) – Text **HOME** to 741741 (US) for 24/7 support.
[Calm](https://www.calm.com/) – Guided sessions for stress, focus, and sleep.
[Mental Health First Aid](https://www.mentalhealthfirstaid.org/) – Learn to support others in crisis.
High: **Emergency (US):** Dial **988** (Suicide & Crisis Lifeline) or **911** if in immediate danger.
[Psychology Today](https://www.psychologytoday.com/us/therapists) – Find a therapist by specialty, location, and insurance.
Search “community mental health center” + your city for **sliding‑scale clinics** near you.
Call your health insurance’s provider line (on back of card) for urgent mental‑health appointments.
Google “crisis stabilization unit” + your area for short‑term intensive care options.
Look up your county’s **mobile crisis team** for on‑site mental‑health support.
For loved ones: if concerned, call emergency services on their behalf or contact the lifeline.
